title: Commending Aquinas Institute of Rochester, New York, upon the occasion of celebrating Spirit Day, September 17, 2010
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commending  Aquinas Institute of Rochester, New
York, upon the occasion of celebrating Spirit Day, September 17, 2010

WHEREAS, It is the sense of  this  Legislative  Body  to  recognize  and
commend  institutions  of  true purpose and high achievement whose exem-
plary programs and accomplishments clearly demonstrate  the  pursuit  of
excellence in education and service to the community; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body is justly  proud  to  commend
Aquinas Institute of Rochester, New York, upon the occasion of celebrat-
ing  Spirit  Day; this auspicious occasion will be celebrated on Friday,
September 17, 2010, during the Institute's  annual  Alumni  and  Reunion
weekend; and
  WHEREAS,  Aquinas  Institute  is a Catholic, coeducational junior high
and high school that has been a Rochester  tradition  since  1902;  over
19,000  graduates  have  been a part of the Aquinas experience; for over
100 years, Aquinas students have  excelled  in  academics,  in  athletic
competitions, in extracurricular activities and in Christian leadership;
and
  WHEREAS, The tradition at Aquinas Institute of Rochester dates back to
1902, when Aquinas' forefather, Cathedral High, opened; in 1925, Aquinas
opened  its  doors at its current location on Dewey Avenue in Rochester;
and
  WHEREAS, Aquinas Institute continues to serve  the  Greater  Rochester
community as the only Catholic, coeducational high school located in the
city  of Rochester; while remaining faithful to its educational mission,
Aquinas has always exhibited the resilience and commitment to adapt,  by
blending the wisdom of the past with the potential of the future; and
  WHEREAS, The unique Aquinas Institute experience offers its students a
college preparatory education in a safe and caring environment; at Aqui-
nas,  there  is a serious and disciplined educational environment with a
strong emphasis on a curriculum designed for college  preparation;  over
97% of Aquinas graduates go on to college; and
  WHEREAS,  Aquinas  Institute  of  Rochester,  New  York,  continues to
fulfill its laudatory educational purposes and is proudly aware  of  its
distinguished  past;  it  is  eager  to  fulfill  its  commitment to its
students, faculty, alumni and community, and is planning with vision and
purpose for the growth and change it will  encounter  in  the  years  to
come; and
  WHEREAS,  This  auspicious  occasion presents a unique opportunity for
this Legislative Body to recognize and pay tribute to the Aquinas Insti-
tute of Rochester, New York; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body that when an  educa-
tional  institution of such noble aims and accomplishments is brought to
our attention, it should be recognized and applauded by all the citizens
of this great Empire State; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
commend  Aquinas  Institute of Rochester, New York, upon the occasion of
celebrating Spirit Day; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to The Aquinas Institute, 1127 Dewey Avenue, Rochester, New York
14613.
